info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN BELMONT...SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...WESTERN GREENE...OHIO AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cameron, or near Moundsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Moundsville, Triadelphia, Valley Grove, Glen Dale, Cameron, Rogersville, West Finley, Aleppo, New Freeport, Nineveh, Grove Oak, Elm Grove, Rocklick, Lone Oak, Grand Vue Park, Dallas, Beelers Station, and Sherrard. This includes Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 6 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
